description: From Latin inhibitus, perfect passive participle of inhibeō (“I hold in, check, restrain”), from in (“in, at, on”), + habeō (“I have, hold, keep”).

verbs.description: inhibit (third-person singular simple present inhibits, present participle inhibiting, simple past and past participle inhibited)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To hold in or hold back; to keep in check; restrain.
